p: SSRs successfully amplifying in A. artemisiifolia were used to genotype 384 individuals, including 321 A. artemisiifolia (16 populations), 20 A. trifida (two populations), 22 A. psilostachya (one population) and 21 A. tenuifolia (one population) individuals ( Table 1). Genotyping was performed at GENTYANE (INRA, Clermont-Ferrand, France). PCR products were labelled with one fluorescent tag (6-FAM, NED, VIC or PET) and loaded on an ABI 3730XL capillary DNA analyzer (Applied Biosystem) with the size standard GS500 LIZ. Peakscanner version 1.0 (Applied Biosystems) and the R package MsatAllele were used to read allele sizes [ 38]. A Principal Component Analysis (PCA) was performed on genotype data using the package adegenet [ 39] in R 3.1.2 in order to examine the genetic relationship among the four species studied.
